title: Make Tiamat/Ravenous Hydra active count as "In combat"
body:
Tiamat/Ravenous Hydra active doesnt count as "In combat". For example when you play Rengar and you want to keep your Ferocity that means, you want to stay in combat, and activate tiamat/Ravenous Hydra active your stacks will run out. I don't think it's inteded to be this way so i just wanted to make the statement that it's in the game like that.

Thanks

replies.body: If it doesn't hit anything, it shouldn't. If you use it and it *does* hit something, but doesn't consider you in combat, I'd have to assume that's a bug.
these vote bots are getting a bit annoying now
What are you in combat with in that situation? It sounds 100% working as intended that casting arbitrary spells at nothing as you move across the map isn't considered combat.
